translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the triplets in the Paṭṭhāna,

original: 21.17. Hetuduka, Vedanāttika🔽Nahetuṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ nasukhāya🔽vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca nahetu sukhāya
analyzed: na hetum na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca  na hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum na sukhāya  vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na hetu sukhāya
translated: The section on causes, the section on feeling

original: vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nahetu nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttamūlaṁ tīṇiyeva. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Vipākaṁ natthi.)
analyzed: vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi 🔽na hetu na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutta mūlam tīṇi yeva saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi vipākam natthi
translated: With a state that is not a cause and is not associated with painful feeling as condition there arises a state that is a cause and is associated with pleasant feeling, a state that is not a cause and is associated with pleasant feeling arises by way of root-cause condition. With a state that is not a cause and is not associated with painful feeling as condition there arises a state that is not a cause and is associated with pleasant feeling, a state that is not a cause and is associated with pleasant feeling arises by way of root-cause condition. With a state that is not a cause and is not associated with painful feeling as condition there arise states that are causes and are associated with pleasant feeling and states that are not causes and are associated with pleasant feeling, states that are not causes and are associated with pleasant feeling arise by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) original: Nahetuṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a condition that is not a root cause and is associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, a condition that is a root cause and is associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling arises. (In brief.) With a root cause as condition, three … With an unobscured as condition, three.
